SOAP Web Services

Lesson
objectives ¢ Describe how Guidewire applications and

external systems can integrate with each
other using SOAP web services

* Configure Guidewire to consume an external
SOAP web service

* Configure Guidewire to publish a SOAP web
service

| What is a SOAP web service Gi

Gi & &

==
Guidewire Web service External
application system

* ASOAP web service is a collection of open protocols and standards used for
exchanging XML-based data between applications

* Applications can be local, distributed, or web-based
* Open protocols and standards such as TCP/IP, SOAP, HTTP, Java, HTML, WSDL, and XML

* Communication is typically synchronous

| SOAP

Vehicle Request

(XML)
52
Vehicle Report
(XML)

SOAP (Simple Object Access Protocol) is an open-standard, XML-based protocol for exchanging
information through a web service

Is a communication protocol designed to communicate via the Internet
Can extend HTTP for XML messaging

Provides data transport for Web services

Can exchange complete documents or call a remote procedure

Is platform and language independent

rN & Exchange Rate
ee System
[5 tl 25

CurrencyAPI

Service: CurrencyAPI
- Method: getRate
- Input: toCurrency (String)

- Input: fromCurrency (String)
- Output: rate (float)

« AWSDL (Web Services Description Language) is an XML-based protocol that
defines the operations available for a web service and the required input and
output values

* Generated by the "publisher"

« Used by the "consumer" to create requests

| WSDL binding styles

WSDL bindings describes how the SOAP web service is bound to a
messaging protocol, particularly the SOAP messaging protocol

* AWSDL SOAP binding supports four style/use models

+ Guidewire supports Documentiliteral (WS-I) binding style

<soapl2:binding transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"
style="document"/>

<soap12:body use="literal"/>

+ XSD attached to the WSDL validates XML

Web service collections (WSC) consume WSDLs that use WS-I|
documents literal binding

* RPCE Web Services are not supported

(BJ ml

| Reference the web service collection in Gosu Gi

* Syntax to reference a web service collection API instance:

* new <package_path>.wscname.wsdlname.ServiceName ()
1 uses trn.ta.webservice. stocks. stockquotewsc. stockapi. StockAPI

var api = new StockAPI()

api.Config.Http.Authentication.Basic.Username = "externalappuser"
api.Config.Http.Authentication.Basic.Password = "gw"
api.Config.CallTimeout = 30000

var stockQuote
print (stockQuote)

api.getQuote ("GWRE")

| Gosu class with SOAP web service annotations Gi

¢ Required

* @WsiWebService annotation is required to declare a class as implementing a SOAP web
service

* Optional

* @WsiPermissions specifies user permissions
+ Default to soapadmin

* @WsiAvailability specifies the minimum system run level when a web service becomes

/ set AP. a

localAPI.Config.Http.Authentication.Basic.Password = "gw"
/ set 1 address

/ retrieve
var contactExist = localAPI.doesContactExist ("ab:5")
var contactInfo = localAPI.getContactInfo("ab:5")
print (contactExist)
print("Summary: " + contactInfo.ContactName +" ; " + contactInfo.Email)

A Guidewire SOAP web service?

A valid return type for Guidewire SOAP web service methods?

A) The @WsiWebService annotation is the only thing required to make a Gosu class
a Guidewire SOAP web service.

B) The @WsiExportable annotation and the keyword "final".

Question G

___ Identify if the following are true or false about a Guidewire WS web
7’ service API:
, A) Itcan return a simple value, such as a boolean or string.
B) Itcan return an instance of any Guidewire data model entity.
C) The WSDL gets generated when you save the class.
D) Itcan list a set of permissions required to use the API.

E) Itcan modify Guidewire data.

Seo e Soe esses see see

Answer fa

7

¢
¢
¢

Soo eS eee soe ese ese

Identify if the following are true or false about a Guidewire WS-I web
~ service API:

A) It can return a simple value, such as a boolean or string. True

B) It can return an instance of any Guidewire data model entity. False — Instances
of Guidewire data model entities cannot be returned from WS-I web service
methods

C) The WSDL gets generated when you save the class. False - The WSDL is
generated when an external system requests it.

D) It can list a set of permissions required to use the API. True
E) It can modify Guidewire data model. False

SOAP web service

service

Soo eS eee soe ese ese

Identify if the following are true or false about a Guidewire WS-I web
~ service API:

A) It can return a simple value, such as a boolean or string. True

B) It can return an instance of any Guidewire data model entity. False — Instances
of Guidewire data model entities cannot be returned from WS-I web service
methods

C) The WSDL gets generated when you save the class. False - The WSDL is
generated when an external system requests it.

D) It can list a set of permissions required to use the API. True
E) It can modify Guidewire data model. False
